result.execSummary:
The defendant Geoffrey Daniel Hesser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.03(1)(b).
  • Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 785.03(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Motion Hearing held on 4-25-16
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:50 pm 
State appears by Public Interest Special Prosecutor Mike Puerner; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan.  
State notes parties have reached an agreement re: misd. files. 

PLEA HEARING IN 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 15CM864: Ct. 1 (Violate Foreign Protection Order)>>D&RI. 
In 15CM2011: Ct. 1 (Violate Foreign Protection Order)>>DISMISS. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Misd. BJ)>>DISMISS. 
                       : Ct. 3 (Misd. BJ)>>DISMISS. 
In 15CM2393: Cts. 3-30 (Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 15CM2393: Ct. 1 (Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction)>>NO CONTEST. 
                       : Ct. 2 (Contempt/Ct-Nonsummary/Punitive Sanction)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

SENTENCING HEARING IN 15CF977 AND 15CM2393. 
COURT questions counsel re: review of PSI and alternate PSI submitted by the defense. 
Atty Jackan makes statement re: PSI. No additions/corrections by the State. 
A.F. makes statement. 
Argument. 
Def makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF977: Ct. 1>>35 years imprisonment with 407 days credit - 20 years IC and 15 years ES - CONDITIONS OF ES: no contact with A.F. or her immediate family; no contact with E.K.H. unless given dept approval and only after psychological examinations of the child (E.K.H.), the mother (A.F.), and the def have been completed; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; comply with sex offender registry; absolutely no access to any device that allows access to the Internet or social media sites including but not limited to smart phones, smart televisions, or computers; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
                    : Ct. 3>>90 days MCJ with 407 days credit. 
                    : Ct. 4>>9 months MCJ with 407 days credit. 
In 15CM2393: Ct. 1>>1 year MCJ with 1 year credit; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
                       : Ct. 2>>1 year MCJ with 1 year credit; CC. 
COURT remits court costs in 15CM2393. 
COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT to each other. 
COURT finds the def NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT allows counsel to retain their copies of the PSI and advises them to maintain their confidentiality. 
COURT ORDERS alternative PSI SEALED. 
COURT remands def into custody for transport to WI Correctional System. 

Adj: 3:12 pm
Review hearing on December 5, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 8:58 am 
INCLUDES 15CF977, 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Date and time set for hearing before commencement of jury trial in 15CF977. 
State requests to file amended information. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT allows amendment of information. 
Deft waives information. 
COURT questions deft re: settlement offers made by the State. 
Deft states wish to proceed to trial. 
COURT notes statement of the case and jury instructions. 
State makes requests re: statement of the case. 
State requests final offer be signed by deft and sealed in Court file. 
COURT orders final offer SEALED. 
COURT notes 4 strikes each. 
COURT questions parties re: time needed for trial - parties state likelihood trial will only take 2 days. 
Parties discuss D.F. as possible witness and need for sequestration. 
COURT allows D.F. to be in courtroom during trial. 
State requests ruling re: DNA results. 
Argument. 
COURT takes matter under advisement. 
Atty Jackan renews motion for jury viewing of vehicle. 
COURT denies motion. 
Atty Jackan notes for the record e-mail from the State prior to previous trial date. 
State makes statement. 
Adj: 9:12 am
Review hearing on July 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 3:04 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF977, 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 

MOTION HEARING IN 15CF977. 
COURT notes motion filed by the State re: Facebook messaging and motion filed by defense re: discover. 

FACEBOOK MOTION. 
COURT ORDERS facebook postings SEALED. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT holds ruling on motions related to facebook messages. 

DISCOVERY MOTION. 
Atty Jackan notes motion is to exclude DNA evidence. 
State notes it filed a response - provides Court with copy of response as one was not in the file. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - denies motion. 

COURT provides parties with proposed Statement of the Case. 
COURT questions Atty Jackan re: bail jumpings. 
Atty Jackan notes parties which to proeceed with conditional plea re: Ct. 4. 
COURT questions parties re: DA enhancer. 
COURT notes intent to give jury a special verdict form. 
COURT questions Atty Jackan re: final offer of the State. 
COURT questions deft re: final offer of the State. 
Deft states he wishes to proceed to trial. 
State requests offer be sealed. 
COURT ORDERS final offer sealed once recieved by the Court.  
COURT directs parties to be present at 8:30 tomorrow morning. 
COURT notes how individual voir dire will be addressed if needed. 
State notes supplemental MIL. 
COURT holds ruling on supplemental MIL. 
Atty Jackan notes no objection to redacted version of jail phone calls. 
Atty Jackan requests phone calls not be identified as being placed from the jail. 
No objection. 
COURT grants. 

CONDITIONAL PLEA HEARING IN RE: CT. 4. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
PLEA: Ct. 4 (Misd. BJ)>>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, and a factual basis. 

Adj: 3:40 pm

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:06 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF977, 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 

ORAL RULING IN 15CF977. 
COURT notes review of CD of jail phone calls. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling. 
COURT directs State to prepare clean copy of CD for review. 
COURT addresses March 2014 incident. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling. 
COURT addresses text messages. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling. 

DEFENSE'S MOTION TO COMPEL DISCOVERY. 
State makes statement - requests protective order re: photographs. 
No objection to protective order. 
COURT gives ruling as stated on the record. 

Atty Jackan requests State be restricted from talking about no contact order. 
COURT grants. 

COURT directs parties to be present at 8:30 morning of trial. 
COURT directs parties to submit statement of the case. 

Bond Continues. 

Adj: 1:30 pm

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 2:01 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF977, 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Date and time set for Motion Hearing in 15CF977. 
Atty Jackan withdraws 2 motions as stated on the record. 

DEFENSE'S MOTION FOR JURY VIEW. 
Argument. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT gives ruling - denies motion. 

STATE'S INTENT TO INTRODUCE JAIL PHONE CALLS. 
Argument. 
COURT notes it is not prepared to give ruling on motion re: jail phone calls as it has not had opportunity to review recordings. 

STATE'S MOTIONS TO ADMIT OTHER ACTS. 
Argument.

STATE'S MOTION FOR SANCTION. 
State notes motion remains outstanding and will need to be addressed in the future. 

Oral Ruling set for April 18, 2016 at 1:05 pm in Br. 3. 
Adj: 2:22 pm

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:03 am 
INCLUDES 15CF977, 15CM864, 15CM2011, AND 15CM2393. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 

MOTION HEARING IN 15CF977. 
COURT notes jury trial is set for 4 days in 15CF977. 
COURT notes recent filing of motions. 
State notes it is prepared to proceed. 
Atty Jackan requests another motion hearing be set to allow time to review motions. 
COURT note another motion hearing to be set. 
COURT addresses standard Motions in Limine. 

DEFENSE MOTIONS IN LIMINE. 
COURT grants #1, 5, 6, 7 as stated, 8 as stated, 11 as stated, 12 as stated, 13 as stated, and 14. 
Atty Jackan requests #2 be addressed at later date. 
Parties address #3, 4, and 9. 
Argument to #10. 
COURT denies #10. 
COURT addresses # 15. 

STATE MOTIONS IN LIMINE. 
COURT grants #1 as stated, 2 as stated, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9, 10, and 11. 
COURT holds #6 in abeyance. 
Parties address # 7. State moves to revoke offer. 

COURT holds other motions in abeyance. 

State raises concern re: jail phone calls. 
Atty Jackan makes statement.

COURT directs parties to see JA to set another motion hearing at least 2 weeks before jury trial.  

Adj: 10:18 am
to Impose Sanctions for Non-Compliance with Purge Conditions and for Additional Sanctions Under 785.04 - stj
Under Wis. Stat. 785.04

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:16 pm 
INCLUDES 15CF977, 15CM2393, 15CM864, AND 15CM2011. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 
Date and time set for hearing State's motion for summary contempt. 
Argument by State. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT commits deft to jail for 90 days - purge conditions: deft to have absolutely no contact with A.F. or cause anyone else to have contact with A.F. 
State to draft order. 
Adj: 1:26 pm

and Demand for Discovery & Inspection
-State's
Hearing at 01-28-2016 01:15 pm
Regarding Defendant's Telephone and Internet Privileges - signed 12/22/15
to Judge Huber from ADA Puerner
-Defendant's
Kathryn Jackan

INCLUDES 15CM2393 & 15CF977   No contact with A.F.-NON WAIVAVLE and D.F. . Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No use of the telephone and email in jail except to contact attorney. 3rd party visitation through Family Resource Center.
